content: we're gonna do a little bit of an experiment or something I like to call
dungeon blocks okay dungeon blocks so this is proof of
concept I'm just using a skull plea which is an oven-baked clay or you can
use an air dry clay like this here is basically just modeling clay that dries
in the air and this is just to kind of put this together as a concept so you
can kind of see how it works so we're going to get some of that clay and we're
going to on the parchment paper baking paper that we have here so the clay does
not stick to it it's also called wax paper and the variety of other names as
has been established in the comments and Facebook messages and emails and SMS and
a variety of other communications via twitter and google+ facebook and email
yes there are probably about 40 different names for that stuff so we're
going to grab enough to create a square which is one inch by one inch and half
inch thick so that's why I've drawn the lines on the parchment paper to make
sure I'm getting the right sort of size and then I'm just using a plastic knife
to flatten it out and I'll put some detailing on there as well just make
sure it gets to the 1 inch by 1 inch square and then the extra half inch I've
measured on the side there so when I pick it up I can just drop it on there
and make sure that it's a half inch thick or if it doesn't fall over and
then I can just do some detailing on one of the sides now if you want you can go
further than this is again is just proof of concept you can do details on both
sides of the thing I'm just going to do it on one side we're going to make it
look like some stonework so it could be either a four or a wall and that's
you'll see why when I put it together why I could be at the floor and a wall
so this is a very very simple idea then going to just put a texture on it with
this hardened sponge that I've been for painting and that creates a nice
sort of stony sort of texture we'll put that on there and then you'll obviously
take it off put it in the oven or let it air dry and then we'll do some painting
as you would be normally now you can also just check out Neverwinter which is
a great little MMO it's free-to-play and it helps support this channel so just go
to play Neverwinter calm /the dmg and that helps create more videos on this
channel so using white and black I am just sponging on some stone details so
I'm now just laying them out so flat for the one-inch squares and on the sides
for the walls as you can see this is essentially the concept of dungeon
blocks so my things but stickies are they were moving around a bit but have a
few comments in the comment section below and tell me what you think how it
can be proved or if I'm just crazy
